item.title: Content Slide
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded:
[row]
[one_third]
[headline icon="icon-brush-1" lined="no" tag="h4" color="color2" first="no"]Fresh, Clean & Modern Design[/headline]
Minicorp comes with fresh, clean and modern design which suits perfectly almost any kind of page. You can use it as a Corporate, Personal, Creative or Product portfolio, but we are sure you will find much more ways to use it for your own projects.
[button url="#" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no" align="right"]Read more[/button]
[/one_third]
[one_third]
[headline icon="icon-html5" lined="no" tag="h4" color="color2" first="no"]HTML5, CSS3, jQuery[/headline]
Minicorp has been cooked with attention on new web design / development trends. Main ingredients are HTML5 & CSS3 with little bit of jQuery spice on top of it for eye-catching features. Bon Appétit...
[button url="#" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no" align="right"]Read more[/button]
[/one_third]
[one_third]
[headline icon="icon-mobile" lined="no" tag="h4" color="color2" ]Fully Responsive[/headline]
Use almost any kind of platform, Mobile, Tablet, E-Reader, Desktop to view Minicorp and it will perfectly adjust to that.
[button url="#" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no" align="right"]Read more[/button]
[/one_third]
[/row]
 
[row]
[one_half]
[headline icon="icon-eye-1" lined="no" tag="h4" color="color2" first="no"]Retina Ready / Pixel Perfect Icons[/headline]
There are more than 1000+ pictograms prepared in Minicorp. Use any kind of icon to make your content more interesting for your visitors. Of course all these pictograms are retina ready so don't be afraid of blured or pixelated icons on retina displays.
[button url="#" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no" align="right"]Read more[/button]
[/one_half]
[one_half]
[headline icon="icon-doc-alt" lined="no" tag="h4" color="color2" first="no"]Well Documented / Easy to Customize[/headline]
Minicorp contains extended documentation with detailed explanation how / what / why / where. The most important, whole Minicorp has been cooked with attention on clean modern code..
[button url="#" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no" align="right"]Read more[/button]
[/one_half]
[/row]
[divider]

item.title: Content slide 2
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: [row] [one_third][headline lined="yes" tag="h4" color="color2" first="yes"]Minicorp built-in Slider.[/headline] The built-in IshYoBoy Slider is a lightweight and extremely easy to use content and image slider. You can create any kind of content combination as all regular content shortcodes are supported within the slider. Try it out yourself and feel the freedom of content editing. Put some awesome content combinations together and make your web presentation unique across the Internet! [button url="#" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no"]Read more about the Slider[/button] [/one_third] [two_thirds] [/two_thirds] [/row]

Whether you are a developer or a newbie you will be able to make thousands of combinations. item.title: 404 Not Found
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: [divider] [row] [one_third][/one_third] [two_thirds] [headline tag="h3" color="color2" lined="yes"]That sneaky puppy! [/headline] We have some serious suspicions that this little fellow has eaten the page you were looking for! Don't worry though.. A team of highly trained WordPress developers and top Web Designers are already chasing it furiously around the yard. Sooner or later it will be caught and you'll get your content! Until then why don't you have a look around if you're not interested in some other content? item.title: Home - Ishyoboy Slider
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded:
[divider] [row] [one_third] [headline icon="icon-brush-1" lined="no" tag="h4" color="color2" first="no"]Fresh, Clean & Modern Design[/headline] Minicorp comes with fresh, clean and modern design which suits perfectly almost any kind of page. You can use it as a Corporate, Personal, Creative or Product portfolio, but we are sure you will find much more ways to use it for your own projects. [button url="http://themes.ishyoboy.com/minicorp/wp/main-features/" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no" align="left"]Explore the theme[/button] [/one_third] [one_third] [headline icon="icon-html5" lined="no" tag="h4" color="color2" first="no"]HTML5, CSS3, jQuery[/headline] Minicorp has been cooked with attention to new web design and  development trends. The main ingredients are HTML5 & CSS3 with a little bit of jQuery spice on top of it, for eye-catching effects. Bon Appétit... [button url="http://themes.ishyoboy.com/minicorp/wp/main-features/" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no" align="left"]Look under the hood[/button] [/one_third] [one_third] [headline icon="icon-mobile" lined="no" tag="h4" color="color2" ]Fully Responsive[/headline] Use almost any kind of platform. Mobile, Tablet, E-Reader, Desktop, PC or Mac to view Minicorp and it will perfectly adjust to it. Minicorp makes sure  to provide the perfect user experience, no matter what device or platform is being used. [button url="http://themes.ishyoboy.com/minicorp/wp/main-features/" size="small" color="color1" new_window="no" align="left"]View all main featurs[/button] [/one_third] [/row] [separator] [row] [one_third] [tabs_navigation pair="homepage-tabs" vertical="yes" color="color3"] [tab_title pair="tab1" active="yes"]Google Maps[/tab_title] [tab_title pair="tab9"]Minicorp[/tab_title] [tab_title pair="tab8"]SEO[/tab_title] [tab_title pair="tab2"]Latest Blog posts[/tab_title] [tab_title pair="tab3"]Latest Portfolio items[/tab_title] [tab_title pair="tab4"]Video content[/tab_title] [tab_title pair="tab5"]Timeline[/tab_title] [tab_title pair="tab6"]Top Support[/tab_title] [tab_title pair="tab7"]Skills bars[/tab_title] [/tabs_navigation] [/one_third] [two_thirds] [tabs_content pair="homepage-tabs"] [tab_content pair="tab1"] [map lat_lng_1="36.509, -4.886" zoom="11" height="288"] [/tab_content] [tab_content pair="tab9"] Minicorp is built on 12 columns fluid responsive grid system. You can be sure your site is perfectly displayed no matter what devices, platform, screen resolution or browser is used. Don’t be limited by the default WordPress functionality which does not allow you to use a shortcode inside the same shortcode (nested shortcodes). See the them in action? [headline tag="div" css_class="h3" color="color1"]Outstanding set of shortcodes[/headline] On top of that, Minicorp comes with an absolutely outstanding set of more than 35 shortcodes available to help you assemble the content just in seconds. Whether you are a developer or a newbie you will be able to make thousands of combinations using the basic configuration or the advanced shortcode attributes. [headline tag="div" css_class="h3" color="color1"]Advanced Theme Options[/headline] You can set everything you can imagine from basic things like uploading your logo, favicon, custom CSS code or custom tracking code to advanced features such as setting your own 404 error page, customizing your header, footer, portfolio, blog and styling theme including colors, patterns, fonts … and a lot more. Explore the screenshots from Minicorp Theme Options. [/tab_content] [tab_content pair="tab8"] [headline tag="div" css_class="h3" color="color1"]SEO - Search Engine Optimization[/headline] Minicorp is built using the latest SEO best practices in mind. Your content can be easily indexed by search engines as every part of the page is made using valid and semantic HTML5 markup. The order of your content is very important for search engines. Minicopr always places the important content before less important in the source code to signalize its importance to the search engines. Headlines are always wrapped in the (H1, H2, H3, ...) HTML headline tags which also increases SEO score. The used heavy internal linking is also of great importance. Minicorp provides breadcrumbs options, navigation menus and many content shordcodes to help you link your pages togeter. With Minicorp WordPress Theme you are perfectly equipped to get very high Google ranking and top positions in search results. It also plays well with the best SEO WordPress Plugins! [/tab_content] [tab_content pair="tab2" active="yes"] [recent_posts order="DESC" columns="2" count="2" show_title_icon="no" show_media="yes" show_date="yes" show_categories="yes" show_author="no" show_tags="no" show_comments="no" slideshow="no" animation="slide" navigation="yes" autoslide="no" interval=""] [/tab_content] [tab_content pair="tab3"] [portfolio category="" order="DESC" navigation="no" pagination="no" view_all="no" height="" per_page="2" columns="3" masonry="no"] [/tab_content] [tab_content pair="tab4"] [embed]http://vimeo.com/32238183[/embed] [/tab_content] [tab_content pair="tab5"] [timeline hover_effect="no"] [timeline_item size="big"] [timeline_content][headline tag="div" color="color1" css_class="h2"]Going live![/headline][/timeline_content] [timeline_date]23. item.title: FAQ
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded:
[section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]FAQ in general[/section_headline]
[row]
[one_fourth]
[tabs_navigation pair="tab_set_1" vertical="yes"]

[divider] [row] [one_third align="center"] [chart percent="20" align="center" size="200" line_width="10" rounded="yes" animation_time="1" icon="icon-mobile" text_size="40"][/chart] [divider] [headline tag="h3" color="color1"]Minicorp is fully responsive[/headline] Minicorp is built on 12 columns fluid responsive grid system. You can be sure your site is perfectly displayed no matter what devices, platform, screen resolution, browser is used … Read more [/one_third] [one_third align="center"] [chart percent="40" align="center" size="200" line_width="10" rounded="yes" animation_time="2" icon="icon-plus-1" text_size="40"][/chart] [divider] [headline tag="h3" color="color1"]WooCommerce & WPML ready[/headline] Would you like to have an e-shop or multilingual page or blog? Not a problem. Minicorp’s best friends are WooCommerce and WPML … Read more [/one_third] [one_third align="center"] [chart percent="60" align="center" size="200" line_width="10" rounded="yes" animation_time="3" icon="icon-wordpress-1" text_size="40"][/chart] [divider] [headline tag="h3" color="color1"]Wordpress 3.6 Fully Compatible[/headline] Not only is Minicorp compatible with the latest version of WordPress but we have also made vast tests to ensure FULL compatibility with the hottest WordPress 3.6 version which is still under development and available only for developers. item.title: Summits of My Life
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: [divider] [row] [embed]http://vimeo.com/42964218[/embed] [two_thirds] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project overview[/section_headline] “Our steps follow our instinct and take us into the unknown. We no longer see the obstacles behind us, but look forward to the ones ahead.” Kilian is about to embark on some colossal personal challenges that will test his fitness, resolve and skills far beyond the reaches of his career so far. Combining his tremendous capacities for physical endurance with the mountain environment he is so passionate about, Kilian will undertake a number of feats throughout the coming years that stand to change our perception of human capabilities ... item.title: The Mountain
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: [divider] [row] [embed]http://vimeo.com/22439234[/embed] [two_thirds] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project overview[/section_headline] This was filmed between 4th and 11th April 2011. I had the pleasure of visiting El Teide. Spain´s highest mountain @(3718m) is one of the best places in the world to photograph the stars and is also the location of Teide Observatories, considered to be one of the world´s best observatories. The goal was to capture the beautiful Milky Way galaxy along with one of the most amazing mountains I know El Teide. I have to say this was one of the most exhausting trips I have done. There was a lot of hiking at high altitudes and probably less than 10 hours of sleep in total for the whole week. Having been here 10-11 times before I had a long list of must-see locations I wanted to capture for this movie, but I am still not 100% used to carrying around so much gear required for time-lapse movies. [portfolio_categories separator=" / " links="yes"] [/two_thirds] [one_third] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project highlights[/section_headline] Follow Facebook: facebook.com/TSOPhotography Follow Twitter: twitter.com/TSOPhotography Follow Google+: plus.google.com/107543460658107759808 Press/licensing/projects contact: tsophotography@gmail.com Music by my friend: Ludovico Einaudi - "Nuvole bianche" with permission. item.title: Food Matters
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: [divider] [row] [embed]http://youtu.be/r4DOQ6Xhqss[/embed] [two_thirds] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project overview[/section_headline] "Let thy Food be thy Medicine and thy Medicine be thy Food." -- Hippocrates That's the message from the founding father of modern medicine echoed in the controversial new documentary film 'Food Matters' from first- time Producer-Directors James Colqhuoun and Laurentine ten Bosch. "With nutritionally-depleted foods, chemical additives and ourtendency to rely upon pharmaceutical drugs to treat what's wrong with our malnourished bodies, it's no wonder that modern society is getting sicker. 'Food Matters' sets about uncovering the trillion dollar worldwide "Sickness Industry" and giving people some scientifically verifiable solutions for curing disease naturally." - James And in what promises to be the most contentious idea put forward, the filmmakers have interviewed several world leaders in nutrition and natural healing who claim that not only are we harming our bodies with improper nutrition, but that the right kind of foods, supplements and detoxification can be used to treat chronic illnesses as fatal as terminally diagnosed cancer. 'Food Matters' is to be launched globally via the internet using full screen video technology. [portfolio_categories separator=" / " links="yes"] [/two_thirds] [one_third] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project highlights[/section_headline] The film's official website can be found at: http://www.foodmatters.tv [/one_third] [/row] [divider] [portfolio_prev_next prev_text=">" next_text="<" align="center"] [divider]

item.title: Into The Mind
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: [divider] [row] [embed]http://vimeo.com/54348266[/embed] [two_thirds] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project overview[/section_headline] Blur the lines between dream state and reality, as you perceive the world through the minds of many. Into the Mind contemplates the experiences passed between mentors and peers to paint a philosophical portrait of human kind. What drives us to overcome challenge? How do we justify risk? What forces are at the core of a mountain addiction? Unique athlete segments over a multitude of mountain sport genres depict the connectivity of Earth, and window into never seen before moments. Explore how we begin our perception of self, construct the foundations of confidence, and are ultimately led up the path of self-actualization. As Buddha once said, “The mind is everything. What you think you become.” Into The Mind is about becoming. Presented by The North Face - COMING FALL 2013 [portfolio_categories separator=" / " links="yes"] [/two_thirds] [one_third] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project highlights[/section_headline] Created by Sherpas Cinema - sherpascinema.com Directors: Dave Mossop and Eric Crosland Producer: Malcolm Sangster Music: A Tribe Called Red - Electric Powwow (Available for free at electricpowwow.com ) Original Score by Jacob Yoffee, Sound Design: Cody Petersen [/one_third] [/row] [divider] [portfolio_prev_next prev_text=">" next_text="<" align="center"] [divider]

item.title: User Interface Design
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded:
[row]

[one_half] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project highlights[/section_headline] Cient: Minicorp Author: Flickr Year: 2013 Category: [portfolio_categories separator=", " links="yes"] [/one_half] [one_half] [section_headline tag="h4" lined="yes" color="color2"]Project overview[/section_headline]

In Interactive Design 3, students are asked to select from one of three client briefs to develop a social change project. Cherie, Michael and Jay chose to develop a mobile application to assist with earthquake preparedness. The application offers device features, such as RSS, GPS tracking and "bounce location" to sustain user correspondence during disaster relief efforts.

The team divided the roles and responsibilities to tackle strategic review, competitive analysis, moodboards, user experience, information architecture and interactive design. Learn more about VFS's one-year Digital Design program at www.vfs.com/digitaldesign. [/one_half] [/row] [divider]

item.title: Video Post about new Zeland
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: [divider] Stars beside all the gear for whole nights at a time catching some sleep here and there between checking the gear and changing batteries and staring up into eternity with spectacular meteors burning up in the cosmic shore out the corner of your eye. [divider] [row] [one_half] This timelapse features Bevan Percival's best work yet. It represents hours and hours of dedication to the art. He's driven by chasing fleeting moments of dramatic light on beautiful landscapes and also capturing the night sky and milky way in all it's glory is a real buzz. Not be mention curling up out under the stars beside all the gear for whole nights at a time catching some sleep here and there between checking the gear and changing batteries and staring up into eternity with spectacular meteors burning up in the cosmic shore out the corner of your eye. [/one_half] [one_half] Doing this sort of thing has bought him closer and closer to the wilderness. There is something about doing this sort of stuff that just makes you want to keep coming back for more and more. Maybe it's the experience of being out there at one with the incredible beauty of this landscape. Maybe it's the challenge of capturing it in the camera in the way that you witnessed it. Maybe it's the excitement of seeing just what you got when you finally render it all out. Maybe it's the satisfaction you get out of showing this to other people. Most probably it's a combination of all these things. [/one_half] [/row] [divider] [row] [one_full align="center"] [button url="https://vimeo.com/62980495" size="small" color="color1" new_window="yes" full_width="no"]Read more on Vimeo.com[/button] [/one_full] [/row]

item.title: Standard post about Alps
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: Hallstatt, Upper Austria, is a village in the Salzkammergut, a region in Austria. It is located near the Hallstätter See. At the 2001 census, it had 946 inhabitants. Alexander Scheutz has been mayor of Hallstatt since 2009. Hallstatt is known for its production of salt, dating back to prehistoric times, and gave its name to the Hallstatt culture, a culture often linked to Celtic, Proto-Celtic, and pre-Illyrian peoples in Early Iron Age Europe, c.800–450 BCE. Some of the earliest archaeological evidence for the Celts was found in Hallstatt. item.title: Standard post about Rila Monastery
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded:
The Monastery of Saint Ivan of Rila, better known as the Rila Monastery (Bulgarian: Рилски манастир, Rilski manastir) is the largest and most famous Eastern Orthodox monastery in Bulgaria. It is situated in the southwestern Rila Mountains, 117 km south of the capital Sofia in the deep valley of the Rilska River at an elevation of 1,147 m above sea level.

item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: A happy, upbeat, light-hearted instrumental piece featuring bells, mandolin and ukelele. Also includes a non-whistling version! Created by metrolightmusic on AudioJungle.

item.title: Video Post - The Arctic Light
item.dc:creator: minicorp_ishyoboy
item.content:encoded: This was filmed between 29th April and 10th May 2011 in the Arctic, on the archipelago Lofoten in Norway by TSO Photography. His favorite natural phenomenon is one he does not even know the name of, even after talking to meteorologists and astrophysicists he is none the wiser.What he's talking about he has decided to call The Arctic Light and it is a natural phenomenon occurring 2-4 weeks before you can see the Midnight Sun.
